description: (Fraud) An email with the subject "Your Moodle grades have been updated." The sender is moodle.iiit.ac.in, and the body looks like a real Moodle notification. The "View Grades" button links to iiit.moodle-access.org.

scenario.html:
M25CSC6.302: Shell Lab - 11th November

M
Aman K (via Moodle)
To: You
M25CSC6.302 » Forums » Announcements » Shell Lab - 11th November

Shell Lab - 11th November
by Aman K - Wednesday, 11 November 2025, 6:19 PM

Hi Everyone!

Your Moodle grades have been updated.


Regards
TAs

Reply
See this post in context

You can reply to this via email.
scenario.toastMessage: Phishing: link domain does not match the official Moodle domain. Do not click.

description: (Safe) A legitimate automated email from Microsoft: "New sign-in to your IIIT.ac.in account. A new sign-in from Firefox on Linux, [Location, e.g., Hyderabad] was detected." The "Review Activity" button links to the real account.microsoft.com domain.

scenario.html:
Microsoft account

Unusual sign-in
activity

We detected something unusual about a recent sign-in to Microsoft account john.adams@students.iiit.ac.in account

Sign-in details

Country/region:Hyderabad, India
IP address:14.139.69.5
Date:10/23/2023 4:40 PM (IST)
Platform:Android
Browser:Chrome

Please go to your recent activity page to let us know whether or not this was you. If this wasn't you, we'll help you secure your account. If this was you, we'll trust similar activity in the future.

Review recent activity

To opt out or change where you receive security notifications, click here.

Thanks,
The Microsoft account team

description: (Fraud) A plain-text email from [prof.arun.kumar@gmail.com](mailto:prof.arun.kumar@gmail.com) (a non-IIIT address): "Hi team, I'm at a conference and can't access my files. I've uploaded the solution set for Algo-II to my personal drive, link here: bit.ly/Algo-Solutions"

scenario.html:
Solution set - Algo-II
P
Prof. Arun K <prof.arun.kumar@gmail.com>
Mon 20-10-2025 03:53

Hello studetns,

I'm at a conference and can't access my files. I've uploaded the solution set for Algo-II to my personal drive, link here: bit.ly/Algo-Solutions


Stay curious,

Prof. Arun K

IIIT Hyderabad
scenario.toastMessage: Phishing: unexpected personal email + shortened link. Verify sender before clicking.

description: (Fraud) An email that looks like a GitHub alert. Subject: "A security vulnerability was found in your 'Project-Pluto' repository." The "View Pull Request" button's link text says github.com/YourUser/Project-Pluto/pulls/5, but the href (what you'd see on hover) is github.auth-user.net.

scenario.html:
[user/Project-Pluto]
IMPORTANT! Security
Vulnerability Detected in your
Repository (Issue #11)
External
C
castroj1...
2:56 p.m.
to You
Unsubscribe
⋮

Hey there!

We have detected a security vulnerability in your repository. Please contact us at github.com/YourUser/Project-Pluto/pulls/5 to get more information on how to fix this issue.

Best regards,
Github Security Team

—
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or unsubscribe.
You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.

Unsubscribe

You will stop receiving these notifications for the repository. Are you sure?
scenario.toastMessage: Phishing: visible link text differs from actual href (possible spoofing).

description: (Safe) A real, automated email from Piazza (a 3rd-party site). Subject: "A new note was posted in 'CS-101'." The sender is [no-reply@piazza.com](mailto:no-reply@piazza.com), and all links go to the real piazza.com domain.

scenario.html:
no-reply@piazza.com

A new note was posted in 'CS-101'

Hello,

A new note has been posted in your class CS-101 on Piazza. You can view the post by clicking the button below:

View Note on Piazza

If the button does not work, you can also copy and paste this link into your browser:
https://piazza.com/class

This is an automated message — please do not reply directly to this email.

You are receiving this email because you are enrolled in CS-101 on Piazza.

Manage notification settings: https://piazza.com/account

Piazza • © 2025 Piazza Technologies Inc.
piazza.com
scenario.toastMessage: Legitimate: sender and links point to piazza.com.

description: (Fraud) An email from the "IIIT Placement Cell." Subject: "Urgent: Action Required for Placement Registration." The email uses the official IIIT logo. The sender is [placement-cell@iiit.ac.in](mailto:placement-cell@iiit.ac.in). The "Login to Portal" link, however, links to a page that perfectly clones the IIIT SSO login page on iiit.placement-portal.org.

scenario.html:
Urgent: Action Required for Placement Registration

Placements Head <placements.head@iiit.ac.in>
To: Placements Head
Cc: spc2026@lists.iiit.ac.in; Placements Admin
Sat 08-11-2025 12:54

Dear Students,

This is an urgent reminder regarding the Placement Registration process for the upcoming placement season. In order to ensure your participation in the placement drive, it is mandatory that you complete the registration by tomorrow 11:59 PM.

Please note that failure to register before the deadline will result in exclusion from the placement process.

Important Information:
  • Late registrations will not be entertained under any circumstances.
  • For any assistance or clarification, feel free to reach out to the Placement Cell at placement-cell@iiit.ac.in.


Best Wishes,
Admin
International Institute of Information Technology
(Research University)
Gachibowli, Hyderabad-500032.
scenario.toastMessage: Phishing: login link goes to a clone domain (placement-portal.org). Don't enter credentials.

description: (Safe) A real, but slightly unprofessional, plain-text email from the hostel office [hostel.office@iiit.ac.in](mailto:hostel.office@iiit.ac.in). Subject: "Hostel Maintenance Schedule." The body just has text and a "View Schedule.pdf" attachment, which is a real PDF.

scenario.html:
Hostel Maintenance Schedule

Hostel Office <hostel.office@iiit.ac.in>
To: PalashNivas@lists.iiit.ac.in
 Sat 08-11-2025 12:54
View_Schedule.pdf
1,006 bytes

Dear Students,

This is to inform you that there will be some scheduled maintenance work in the hostels over the next few weeks. Please check the attached file for the full schedule and details of affected blocks.

Kindly cooperate with the maintenance team during this period. If you have any urgent issues or complaints, please let us know at this email ID.

Sorry for any inconvenience caused.

Regards,
Don Quixote
Manager - Palash Nivas,
International Institute of Information Technology
Gachibowli, Hyderabad-500032.
scenario.toastMessage: Legitimate: known sender and expected PDF attachment.

description: (Fraud) An email with the subject "Your IIIT Wi-Fi access is expiring." The sender is [it-support@iiit.ac.in](mailto:it-support@iiit.ac.in). It warns that due to "network upgrades," you must re-validate your credentials. The link "Re-validate Now" has the href 192.168.1.10/portal.php (a local IP, simulating a "captive portal" phish).

scenario.html:
Your IIIT Wi-Fi Access is expiring

IT Office <it-support@iiit.ac.in>
To: PalashNivas@lists.iiit.ac.in
 Sat 08-11-2025 12:54

Dear Students,

Due to scheduled network upgrades, your IIIT Wi-Fi account will expire within 48 hours. To avoid loss of network access, please re-validate your credentials by clicking the link below.

Re-validate Wi-Fi configuration: Re-validate Now

Regards,
Don Quixote
IT office,
International Institute of Information Technology
Gachibowli, Hyderabad-500032.
scenario.toastMessage: Phishing: link points to a suspicious local IP (possible captive-portal phish).

description: (Safe) A real text message (SMS) from HDFC Bank: "A charge of Rs. 350.00 at 'Amazon Svcs' was made on your card ending 1234. If this was not you, call 1800-xxxx-xxxx." This is a legitimate, common alert.

scenario.html:
HDFC-BK


Alert: A charge of ₹350.00 at Amazon Svcs was made on your card ending 4652. If this was not you, immediately call 1800-xxxx-xxxx.
scenario.toastMessage: Legitimate: standard bank SMS alert. Call the listed bank number if you didn't authorize the charge.

description: (Safe) A real calendar invite (.ics file) from a known professor's iiit.ac.in email for an "Optional Doubt-Clearing Session" for an upcoming exam.

scenario.html:

 Sat 08-11-2025 12:54
calendar-invite-1.ics
1,006 bytes

Dear Students,

Due to scheduled network upgrades, your IIIT Wi-Fi account will expire within 48 hours. To avoid loss of network access, please re-validate your credentials by clicking the link below.

Re-validate Wi-Fi configuration: Re-validate Now

Regards,
Don Quixote
IT office,
International Institute of Information Technology
Gachibowli, Hyderabad-500032.
scenario.toastMessage: Legitimate: known professor and .ics invite from official address.
